required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ultrasound Guided Peripheral Intravenous Catheter Insertion in the Hospitalized Patient: Long vs. Short Axis Placement
clinical_study.official_title: Ultrasound Guided Peripheral Intravenous Catheter Insertion in the Hospitalized Patient: Long vs. Short Axis Placement

brief_summary.textblock: Comparison of peripheral IV catheters inserted by ultrasound using the long axis vs. the short axis technique. Our hypothesis is that long axis ultrasound placement will increase the longevity of the IV catheter.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.description: How many catheters survived for 3 days or as long as they are needed.

secondary_outcome.measure: success rate of peripheral IV using ultrasound assistance

arm_group.arm_group_label: Long axis ultrasound placement of IV
arm_group.description: Long axis ultrasound placement of IV catheter

arm_group.arm_group_label: Short axis ultrasound placement of IV
arm_group.description: Long axis ultrasound placement of IV catheter

intervention.intervention_name: Long axis IV placement with ultrasound
intervention.description: Peripheral IV placement with the ultrasound probe viewing the vessel in the long axis.
intervention.arm_group_label: Long axis ultrasound placement of IV

intervention.intervention_name: Short axis IV placement with ultrasound
intervention.description: Peripheral IV placement with the ultrasound probe viewing the vessel in the short axis.
intervention.arm_group_label: Short axis ultrasound placement of IV

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- A patient who needs PIV access for intravenous medications and resuscitation either on a medical-surgical floor or in the ICU
- After floor team (including RN and/or house staff) and IV Nurse have attempted and failed or is not available
Exclusion Criteria:
- Need for vasopressors
- Need for TPN
- Need for hemodynamic monitoring
- Non English speaking patient
- Patients who are unable to consent
